Google Data Java Client Library version 2.2.1-alpha

See: http://code.google.com/p/gdata-java-client/wiki/Version2

The Google Data (GData) client library version 2 in general supports all Java 2 Standard Edition environments, including Android and App Engine. This download is for all Java environments except Android.

The download for the Android environment can be found at: gdata-android-2.2.1-alpha.zip

Jar libraries

When building an application for all Java environments other than Android, simplify your build process by just using the all-in-one jar.

  • gdata-2.2.1-alpha.jar: required
  • dependencies/jackson-core-asl-1.5.0.jar: needed for user-defined JSON data models
  • dependencies/kxml2-2.3.0.jar: needed for user-defined XML data models
  • dependencies/commons-logging-1.1.1.jar, dependencies/httpcore-4.0.1.jar, and dependencies/httpclient-4.0.1.jar: needed only if you prefer to use the Apache HTTP library for the underlying HTTP transport (default is to use the built-in java.net package of the JDK). Warning: Do not use the Apache HTTP library on App Engine because it won't work. It tries to open its own sockets which is not allowed on App Engine.

Source Code

All source code is included in gdata-2.2.1-alpha-src.zip .

JavaDoc

The JavaDoc can be found at: http://gdata-java-client.googlecode.com/svn/tags/2.2.1-alpha/javadoc/index.html .

If you want to download the JavaDoc, simply check it out from the Subversion repository using: svn checkout http://gdata-java-client.googlecode.com/svn/tags/2.2.1-alpha/javadoc javadoc
